hackathon-description-text: We encourage coders of all abilities to participate.
hackathon-eligibility:
Individuals or teams may compete.
All teams must have no more than five people.
All UCSC students are welcome to participate.
hackathon-rules:
This is a begginer friendly hackathon. All submissions are welcome, and as always, be respectful of your peers. Review and accept the HackACM's 
 below.
Keep an eye on our 
 to avoid missing any important deadlines.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: One Echo Dot for each team member ($50 cash value per Dot). This is a sponsor prize that goes out to the best team that incorporates Amazon Alexa in their hack.
If this is your first hackathon (or a majority of your team members are first timers) you are eligible to win a $50 Amazon gift card

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Engineering 2, 1156 High St, Santa Cruz, CA 95064, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: We will look for any new and fun ideas introduced by your hack, as well as any imaginative solutions to a problem, or novel application of an old concept.
How complete is your hack? It's a 12 hour hack, so we're not expecting all projects to be complete, but given the constraints how far were you able to get? Even if incomplete, is the idea there?
We will be looking at whether your hack pushed you to learn something new, and how you and your team were able to adapt to the challenge.
This category  appertains to any useful app, program, or utility that is useful for UCSC (or other) students. The most impactful hack that satisfies this category will be selected.
A $50 dollar Amazon gift card will be awarded to the best beginner team: a beginner team is any team where a majority of the team members are beginners.
An echo dot is awarded to each winning team member that submits a project using the Echo Dots.

hackathon-location-address: Engineering 2, 1156 High St, Santa Cruz, CA 95064, USA
hackathon-description-header: HackACM is an educational and beginner-friendly event that fuses competition and meaningful learning.
